gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19115-2 Geographic Information - Metadata - Part 2: Extensions for Imagery and Gridded Data

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: Temperature, pH, DO, and salinity data from Mumford Cove in Connecticut, USA starting in April 2015
Marine Biological Laboratory/Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution Library (MBLWHOI DLA)

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Temperature, pH, DO, and salinity monitoring data from Mumford Cove, CT USA Dataset Description: <p>Since April 2015,&nbsp;pH, DO, temperature, and salinity measurements have been taken in 30 min intervals in Mumford Cove, CT, United States. This is a shallow&nbsp;cove that is typical for the area.</p><p>This dataset includes records from 4/4/2015 to 8/25/2016&nbsp;</p> Acquisition Description: <p>All measurements were made with Eureka Manta Sub2 probes (www.waterprobes.com). The measurement interval was 30 minutes. All measurements were made in Mumford Cove, CT, ~ 0.5m above sandy bottom. Deployment time of each sensor varied between 3-6 weeks, all probes were calibrated prior to deployment for salinity, pH, 100% air-saturated water oxygen. The probe was attached to a local subsurface buoy.</p><p><strong>pH:</strong>&nbsp;calibrated with 3-point, NIST certified buffers, accuracy +/- 0.1, precision: 0.01, automatic temperature correction<br /><strong>Optically Measured DO (HDO):&nbsp;</strong>calibrated with 100% air-saturated water<br /><strong>Salinity:</strong>&nbsp;Calibrated with FisherScientific Conductivity standard 50,000 uS/cm</p>

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Funding provided by NSF Division of Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-1536336 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward.do?AwardNumber=1536336

gmd:keyword.gmx:Anchor: conductivity from the CTD primary sensor
salinity calculated from CTD primary sensors

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Access Constraints: none. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: Understanding the effects of acidification and hypoxia within and across generations in a coastal marine fish

gmd:name.gmx:Anchor: Understanding the effects of acidification and hypoxia within and across generations in a coastal marine fish

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Description from NSF award abstract:Coastal marine ecosystems provide a number of important services and resources for humans, and at the same time, coastal waters are subject to environmental stressors such as increases in ocean acidification and reductions in dissolved oxygen. The effects of these stressors on coastal marine organisms remain poorly understood because most research to date has examined the sensitivity of species to one factor, but not to more than one in combination. This project will determine how a model fish species, the Atlantic silverside, will respond to observed and predicted levels of dissolved carbon dioxide (CO2) and oxygen (O2). Shorter-term experiments will measure embryo and larval survival, growth, and metabolism, and determine whether parents experiencing stressful conditions produce more robust offspring. Longer-term experiments will study the consequences of ocean acidification over the entire life span by quantifying the effects of high-CO2 conditions on the ratio of males to females, lifetime growth, and reproductive investment. These studies will provide a more comprehensive view of how multiple stressors may impact populations of Atlantic silversides and potentially other important forage fish species. This collaborative project will support and train three graduate students at the University of Connecticut and the Stony Brook University (NY), two institutions that attract students from minority groups. It will also provide a variety of opportunities for undergraduates to participate in research and the public to learn about the study, through summer research projects, incorporation in the "Women in Science and Engineering" program, and interactive displays of environmental data from monitoring buoys. The two early-career investigators are committed to increasing ocean literacy and awareness of NSF-funded research through public talks and presentations.This project responds to the recognized need for multi-stressor assessments of species sensitivities to anthropogenic environmental change. It will combine environmental monitoring with advanced experimental approaches to characterize early and whole life consequences of acidification and hypoxia in the Atlantic silverside (Menidia menidia), a valued model species and important forage fish along most of the US east coast. Experiments will employ a newly constructed, computer-controlled fish rearing system to allow independent and combined manipulation of seawater pCO2 and dissolved oxygen (DO) content and the application of static and fluctuating pCO2 and DO levels that were chosen to represent contemporary and potential future scenarios in productive coastal habitats. First CO2, DO, and CO2 × DO dependent reaction norms will be quantified for fitness-relevant early life history (ELH) traits including pre- and post-hatch survival, time to hatch, post-hatch growth, by rearing offspring collected from wild adults from fertilization to 20 days post hatch (dph) using a full factorial design of 3 CO2 × 3 DO levels. Second, the effects of tidal and diel CO2 × DO fluctuations of different amplitudes on silverside ELH traits will be quantified. To address knowledge gaps regarding the CO2-sensitivity in this species, laboratory manipulations of adult spawner environments and reciprocal offspring exposure experiments will elucidate the role of transgenerational plasticity as a potential short-term mechanism to cope with changing environments. To better understand the mechanisms of fish early life CO2-sensitivity, the effects of temperature × CO2 on pre- and post-hatch metabolism will be robustly quantified. The final objective is to rear silversides from fertilization to maturity under different CO2 levels and assess potential CO2-effects on sex ratio and whole life growth and fecundity.Related references:Gobler, C.J. and Baumann, H. (2016) Hypoxia and acidification in ocean ecosystems: Coupled dynamics and effects on marine life. Biology Letters 12:20150976. doi:10.1098/rsbl.2015.0976Baumann, H. (2016) Combined effects of ocean acidification, warming, and hypoxia on marine organisms. Limnology and Oceanography e-Lectures 6:1-43. doi:10.1002/loe2.10002Depasquale, E., Baumann, H., and Gobler, C.J. (2015) Variation in early life stage vulnerability among Northwest Atlantic estuarine forage fish to ocean acidification and low oxygen Marine Ecology Progress Series 523: 145–156.doi:10.3354/meps11142

mm/dd/yy http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/659908.rdf Name: time Units: unitless Description: Time that samples were taken; HH:MM:SS http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/659909.rdf Name: ISO_DateTime_UTC Units: unitless Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formatted; YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/659910.rdf Name: temp Units: celsius Description: Water temperature on site http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/659911.rdf Name: pH Units: unitless Description: pH level on site; NIST calibrated with three point NIST calibration buffers (4.00; 7.00; 10.00) http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/659912.rdf Name: conductivity Units: uS/cm Description: Conductivity; Calibrated with FisherScientific Conductivity standard 50000 http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/659913.rdf Name: HDO_mgPerL Units: milligrams per liter (mg/L) Description: Oxygen saturation; optically measured dissolved oxygen calibrated using 100% air-saturated water http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/659915.rdf Name: pH_mV Units: millivolts (mV) Description: Voltage from pH http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/659916.rdf Name: salinity Units: PSS Description: Salinity on site http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/659917.rdf Name: depth Units: meters Description: Depth where measurement was taken; gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LATX/ Name: LATITUDE Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LONX/ Name: LONGITUDE Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/ADATAA01/ Name: Date (UT as yyyymmdd) Description: Unavailable http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/AHMSAA01/ Name: Time (UT as hh24miss) Description: Time elapsed between 00:00 UT on the date of the event of interest and that event. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/DTUT8601/ Name: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision) Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z' http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/PHXXZZXX/ Name: pH per unit volume of the water body Description: Minus the log of the hydrogen ion concentration (moles per litre) in the water column. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/CNDC/ Name: Electrical conductivity of the water column Description: Parameters quantifying the flow of electrical current through or the electrical resistance of a body of water at any point between the bed and the atmosphere http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/OXYSZZ01/ Name: Saturation of oxygen {O2} in the water body [dissolved phase] Description: Computed (algorithm/data source unspecified) http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/PSALST01/ Name: Practical salinity of the water body by CTD and computation using UNESCO 1983 algorithm Description: This is the preferred term for this definition. Alternative term PSALST02 is included to cover cases where there are two sensors of the same type contributing to the data set and referential integrity considerations prevent a usage of a single code. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/DEPH/ Name: DEPTH BELOW SEA SURFACE Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Location where measurments were taken.; General Description: Sampling site identification.

PI-supplied Description: Latitude; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Longitude; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.
PI-supplied Description: Serial number of the sampling probe; General Description: instrument used to collect or process data, definition is specific to the data set in which it appears

PI-supplied Description: Date that samples were taken; mm/dd/yy; General Description: date; generally reported in GMT as YYYYMMDD (year; month; day); also as MMDD (month; day); EqPac dates are local Hawaii time NERC Description: Unavailable

PI-supplied Description: Time that samples were taken; HH:MM:SS; General Description: Time GMT defined as HHMM; time of day; generally reported in GMT as HHMM (hours and minutes) but may also be HH.H (decimal hours) or HHMMSS (hours; minutes and seconds); in EqPac time is reported as Hawaii local time NERC Description: Time elapsed between 00:00 UT on the date of the event of interest and that event.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formatted; YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS; General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

PI-supplied Description: Water temperature on site; General Description: Temperature in degrees C of a sample or other item. A generic temperature measurement.Note: This is NOT water temp or sea surface temp

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: pH per unit volume of the water body

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: pH level on site; NIST calibrated with three point NIST calibration buffers (4.00; 7.00; 10.00); General Description: pH: The measure of the acidity or basicity of an aqueous solution NERC Description: Minus the log of the hydrogen ion concentration (moles per litre) in the water column.

gmd:sequenceIdentifier.xlink:title: conductivity from the CTD primary sensor

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Electrical conductivity of the water column

gco:aName.gco:CharacterString: conductivity from the CTD primary sensor

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Conductivity; Calibrated with FisherScientific Conductivity standard 50000; General Description: conductivity, from the CTD 'primary sensor', usually reported in Siemens/meter. Depending on input source may have a variety of names. NERC Description: Parameters quantifying the flow of electrical current through or the electrical resistance of a body of water at any point between the bed and the atmosphere

PI-supplied Description: Oxygen saturation; optically measured dissolved oxygen calibrated using 100% air-saturated water; General Description: ml/L of dissolved oxygen is the equivalent of parts per thousand, which is the same as the percentage. But the volume and mass of gasses are not the same, so ml/L is not the exact same as mg/L. 1 PPT = % = 1.33 mg/L

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Saturation of oxygen {O2} in the water body [dissolved phase]

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Percent oxygen saturation; optically measured dissolved oxygen calibrated using 100% air-saturated water; General Description: Saturation of oxygen in the water body, as a percentage. NERC Description: Computed (algorithm/data source unspecified)
PI-supplied Description: Voltage from pH; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined

gmd:sequenceIdentifier.xlink:title: salinity calculated from CTD primary sensors

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Practical salinity of the water body by CTD and computation using UNESCO 1983 algorithm

gco:aName.gco:CharacterString: salinity calculated from CTD primary sensors

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Salinity on site; General Description: salinity, calculated from the CTD 'primary sensors' of conductivity and temperature, Practical Salinity Scale (PSS-78), dimensionless. Depending on the input source, salinity from the primary sensors can have a variety of names i.e. s0, s00, sal0, sal00. NERC Description: This is the preferred term for this definition. Alternative term PSALST02 is included to cover cases where there are two sensors of the same type contributing to the data set and referential integrity considerations prevent a usage of a single code.

PI-supplied Description: Depth where measurement was taken; Earlier measurements did not have a depth sensor; Note that the sensor position ~0.5m above bottom did not change; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p>All measurements were made with Eureka Manta Sub2 probes (www.waterprobes.com). The measurement interval was 30 minutes. All measurements were made in Mumford Cove, CT, ~ 0.5m above sandy bottom. Deployment time of each sensor varied between 3-6 weeks, all probes were calibrated prior to deployment for salinity, pH, 100% air-saturated water oxygen. The probe was attached to a local subsurface buoy.</p><p><strong>pH:</strong>&nbsp;calibrated with 3-point, NIST certified buffers, accuracy +/- 0.1, precision: 0.01, automatic temperature correction<br /><strong>Optically Measured DO (HDO):&nbsp;</strong>calibrated with 100% air-saturated water<br /><strong>Salinity:</strong>&nbsp;Calibrated with FisherScientific Conductivity standard 50,000 uS/cm</p>

<p>QA/QC consisted of identifying and deleting salinity data&nbsp;that ‘jumped’ within a single 30 min interval more than 1 salinity unit.&nbsp;</p><p><strong>BCO-DMO Processing Notes:</strong></p><p>- Removed spaces in data values and replaced with underscores<br />- Reformatted column names to comply with BCO-DMO standards<br />- All blank cells were filled with "nd"</p>

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: Eureka Manta Sub2 probe PI Supplied Instrument Description:Took data on temperature, pH, DO, and salinity Instrument Name: Water Quality Multiprobe Instrument Short Name:Water Quality Multiprobe Instrument Description: An instrument which measures multiple water quality parameters based on the sensor configuration.
